Nerangs.ab: ParagnaLL2.2.1 Var. a (Mss. K7, RJ; RKS):

xšnaoϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ goftan aivyanghan bar miyān-e barsom be dasturi ke kosti bar miyān mi-bandand pičidan va barsom šemordan va barsom ke kučektar bāšad be aṣ̌əm sar-aš boridan pe vohū yeki digar yekǧou bolandtar ān boridan pe vahištəm bāqi ǧou bolandtar išān sar-aš boridan va pas uštā astī uštā ahmāi hiiat̰ aṣ̌āi vahištāi aṣ̌əm

"He should recite xšnaoϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ and then twine the aivyanghan in the middle of the barsom in the same way as the tie the kosti in the middle (of the waist). He should count the barsom(-twigs) and (check) which one is the smallest. At aṣ̌əm he should cut its end (the one of the smallest). At vohū, he should cut another one, one corn of barley longer than that one. At vahištəm, he should cut the end of the rest of twigs, one corn of barley longer than the previous ones."
xšnaoϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ ʿaivyānghan avar miyān-e barsom nahādan va aṣ̌əm vohī yek goftan aṣ̌əm kas va vohī miyāne va vahištəm mas čidan tamām goftan

"(He must recite) xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ and put the aivyānhān on the middle of the barsom. He should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. At aṣ̌əm, he should cut a small one; at vohū, a middle one; at vahištəm, a bigger one and recite it complete."

Quotations.ab: ā-š harw barsom-ē rāy ā-š aṣ̌əm vohū ẏaθā ahū vairiiō-ē bē gōwišn ka abāz ō abestāg ī rāspīgīh estēd ā-š nōg wāz frāz gīrišn.
"Thus for each barsom (twig) he should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and and one ẏaθā ahū vairiiō. When he is back to (the recititation of) the abastāg proper of the rāspīg, he should take the wāz anew."
